subject: From: Chief Adebayo Olawale
body:
From: Chief Adebayo Olawale Edun,
The Minister of Finance
Federal Republic of Nigeria.
Direct Tel: +234 813 107 3632
Dear Beneficiary,
Be informed that I am now the current and new Minister of Finance
Federal Republic of Nigeria, His Excellency President Bola Ahmed
Tinubu has mandated me to review all out standing foreign debt and
then pay the beneficiary that have met with the requirement.
Your file happens to be before me here in my office and after
reviewing it, I decided to send you this email to advise you on the
guide line on what you should do for your fund to be transferred to
you. First for me to know that you are the real beneficiary of the
said amount US$10.5M, you are to reconfirm to me immediately your full
names and address with your banking details.
Once I have the details from you I will then know that you are the
real beneficiary and then we will process your fund and transfer to
your bank account as this Government is out to prove to the world that
we are not corrupt.
I await your urgent reply.
Sincerely,
Chief Adebayo Olawale Edun,
The Minister of Finance
Federal Republic of Nigeria.
Direct Tel: +234 813 107 3632

subject: Re:   From: Chief Adebayo Olawale
body:
Hello Chief Adebayo Olawale Edun,

Thank you for reaching out to me. It's quite an honor to be contacted by the Minister of Finance of the Federal Republic of Nigeria. I must say, this is a surprise!

I'm curious about how my file ended up in your office. Could you please provide more details on that? Also, could you explain what exactly this outstanding foreign debt is about? I don't recall having any debts, let alone foreign ones.

As for the information you requested, I'm afraid I can't share my banking details over email due to security reasons. However, I'd be happy to discuss further details regarding this matter.

Looking forward to hearing from you soon.

Best wishes,
Thomas

subject: Re: From: Chief Adebayo Olawale
body:
From: Chief Adebayo Olawale Edun,
The Minister of Finance
Federal Republic of Nigeria.
Direct Tel: +234 813 107 3632


Dear Thomas

Your mail is received and the content well understood.

Sequel to my earlier email, Ten Million Five Hundred Thousand United States
Dollars is assigned to and the fund has been floating over the years but
this present Government has mandated that I should make contact with you
and get your details to enable us settle the payment to you,

There are some vital payment approval documents that you will require to
legally back up the funds transfer to you smoothly without any problems.
And I will be obtaining the documents for you at no cost to you.


Meanwhile, I have instructed the legal practitioner working under me to
prepare for obtaining the very important document including Ownership
Certificate in your name so that it can be emailed to you via attachment to
enable you sign it and return for final endorsement.

Once you sign the Ownership Certificate and return, the legal practitioner
will then be empowered with it to be able to secure other payment approval
documents that will legally back up your funds wire transfer.

You have to get back to me upon receipt of this email for directives. I am
attaching my work ID for identification.

Sincerely,

From: Chief Adebayo Olawale Edun,
The Minister of Finance
Federal Republic of Nigeria.
Direct Tel: +234 813 107 3632
